block.p: Charisse Mari Kiino, the daughter of Cecealia and Ronald Kiino of Santa Ana, Calif., was married yesterday to David Rothenberg, the son of Rosalie and Joel Rothenberg of Larchmont, N.Y. Rabbi Bernard Cohen officiated at the DeAngelo Estate in Orange, Calif.
The couple graduated from Princeton University, where they met.

Charisse Mari Kiino, the daughter of Cecealia and Ronald Kiino of Santa Ana, Calif., was married yesterday to David Rothenberg, the son of Rosalie and Joel Rothenberg of Larchmont, N.Y. Rabbi Bernard Cohen officiated at the DeAngelo Estate in Orange, Calif.
The couple graduated from Princeton University, where they met.

Ms. Kiino, 29, is keeping her name. She is an acquisitions editor at CQ Press, the books division of Congressional Quarterly, in Washington. Her father owns Murf Wear, a surfwear design company in Tustin, Calif. Her mother is a hospice nurse with Vitas, a nursing-care company in Anaheim.

Mr. Rothenberg, 30, is the chief executive of MDLinx.com, a research Web site for health care professionals, based in Washington. He received a master's degree in international relations from Cambridge University, in England, and a law degree from Harvard. He is also a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, the policy research institute in New York. His father is the president of the Ekstein-Rothenberg Corporation, a real estate finance company in New York.
